edu.biu.scapi.primitives.hash
Interface CryptographicHash

All Known Subinterfaces:
SHA1, SHA224, SHA256, SHA384, SHA512
All Known Implementing Classes:
BcHash, BcSHA1, BcSHA224, BcSHA256, BcSHA384, BcSHA512, CryptoPpHash, CryptoPpSHA1, CryptoPpSHA224, CryptoPpSHA256, CryptoPpSHA384, CryptoPpSHA512, OpenSSLHash, OpenSSLSHA1, OpenSSLSHA224, OpenSSLSHA256, OpenSSLSHA384, OpenSSLSHA512
public interface CryptographicHash

General interface for CryptographicHash. Every concrete class should implement this interface.

A cryptographic hash function is a deterministic procedure that takes an arbitrary block of data and returns a fixed-size bit string, the (cryptographic) hash value.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Meital Levy)

Method Detail

getAlgorithmName

java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
Returns:
The algorithm name. For example - SHA1

getHashedMsgSize

int getHashedMsgSize()
Returns:
the size of the hashed massage in bytes

update

void update(byte[] in,
            int inOffset,
            int inLen)
Adds the byte array to the existing message to hash.

Parameters:
in - input byte array
inOffset - the offset within the byte array
inLen - the length. The number of bytes to take after the offset

hashFinal

void hashFinal(byte[] out,
               int outOffset)
Completes the hash computation and puts the result in the out array.

Parameters:
out - the output in byte array
outOffset - the offset which to put the result bytes from
